faq.name: Wave 1 FAQ

entry.question: Can I have more than one of the same character on my team?
entry.answer: You can’t have more than one of the same character card on your team, but you can have more than one of the same character if they’re on different cards. For example, your team can’t have two copies Bumblebee, Brave Warrior, but it could have one Bumblebee, Brave Warrior and one Bumblebee, Courageous Scout.

entry.question: Can my team have both Autobots and Decepticons?
entry.answer: Yes. All characters in the game can work together under your leadership.

entry.question: Some cards refer to Autobots or Decepticons. How do I know which characters are Autobots?
entry.answer: Autobots have a red frame and the Autobot insignia in the lower right corner. Decepticons have a purple frame and the Decepticon insignia in the lower right corner. A few characters have "Autobot" or "Decepticon" in their names, although these aren’t the only Autobots and Decepticons.

entry.question: Some cards refer to the number of stars a character has. Does a character in bot mode have any stars?
entry.answer: Yes. Even though the stars are printed on the alt mode side of the card, the character has that number of stars no matter which mode it’s in.

entry.question: Can the same character attack 2 turns in a row?
entry.answer: As long as that character is untapped, sure. (The basic rules used with the Autobot Starter Set say that a character can’t attack twice in a row, but that rule isn’t part of the Advanced Rules.)

entry.question: What happens if a character has more than one instance of Bold or Tough?
entry.answer: Each Bold or Tough ability works. For example, if a creature with Bold 1 got a Weapon that gave it Bold 2, it would flip 3 additional cards when attacking.

entry.question: How does Pierce work?
entry.answer: Pierce tells you the minimum amount of damage a character can do in an attack, although a character can never do more damage than its attack total. For example, say a character with Pierce 2 attacks. After flipping battle cards, the attack total is 5 and the defense total is 4. Normally, the character with Pierce would do only 1 damage, but because of Pierce, it does 2 damage instead. This also works if the attack total is equal to or less than the defense total. Say the attacker has an attack total of 5, but this time it runs into a massive defense total of 9. If that character had Pierce 2, it would still do 2 damage. If the character with Pierce 2 had an attack total of only 1, it would do 1 damage against any defense total.

entry.question: Can other effects change the amount of damage done after Pierce is applied?
entry.answer: Yes. For example, say a character with Pierce 4 attacks Insecticon Skrapnel in bot mode. (He has the ability "This can't take more than 3 attack damage from a single attack.") After battle cards are flipped, the attacking character would do 2 damage, but Pierce raises that to 4. Insecticon Skrapnel’s ability would then reduce the damage done to 3.

entry.question: Can I have more than one of the same Upgrade on the battlefield?
entry.answer: Yes. Upgrades aren’t unique. You could have two characters each with the same Weapon, for example.

entry.question: Some Upgrades say "Put on [something] only." How does that work?
entry.answer: These abilities describe what kind of character the Upgrade can be put on. This is usually a trait such as Melee, Plane, or Insecticon. An Upgrade can be put on a character only if that character matches the listed requirement.

entry.question: Let’s say I have an Upgrade that says "Put on Planes only" and I put it on a Plane. But then next turn I flip the Plane to its other mode, and it’s no longer a Plane. What happens?
entry.answer: The Upgrade stays with the character it’s on. That ability limits only what the Upgrade can initially be put on. Once that happens, the Upgrade doesn’t check again.

entry.question: If one of my characters is KO’d, does it keep its damage counters?
entry.answer: A KO’d character has damage counters on it equal to its health. Note that this is true even if it took more damage while on the battlefield. For example, if a character with 7 health takes 10 damage, it ends up in the KO area with 7 damage counters.

entry.question: If one of my characters is KO’d, what mode is it in?
entry.answer: Characters don’t change modes when are KO’d. If a character was in bot mode when it was KO’d, it will be put in the KO area in bot mode.

entry.question: If a card returns a KO’d character to the battlefield, what mode is it in? Is it tapped or untapped?
entry.answer: Unless the card that returns the character says otherwise, it will be untapped and in the same mode it was in the KO area.

faq.target:
What is a triggered ability?
A triggered ability is an ability that’s caused by a specified game action. They’re usually written in the form "When [something happens] -> [effect]." The effect happens just after the specified game action is taken. For example, many characters have triggered abilities that start with "When you flip to this mode." The effects of these abilities happen immediately after you flip the character to the appropriate mode.
What happens if more than one triggered ability triggers at the same time?
Triggered abilities always happen one at a time. If all the triggered abilities belong to one player, that
player chooses their order. If both players have triggered abilities that would happen at the same time, first the player whose turn it is handles all their triggered abilities in any order, then the other player does the same with their triggered abilities.

entry.question: What happens if some of my characters are undamaged when I flip Arcee to alt mode?
entry.answer: There are no damage counters to remove, so nothing happens to those characters.

entry.question: If Arcee’s attack is boosted by actions or Upgrades, does that raise her Pierce number?
entry.answer: Yes. For example, if you play an action card that gives Arcee +2 attack until end of turn, she’ll have Pierce 3.

entry.question: Let’s say I attack with Arcee and reveal two orange attack icons, giving her +2 attack. Does her Pierce number go up?
entry.answer: Yes.

entry.question: What happens if Arcee has a Piercing Blaster or another Upgrade that gives her more Pierce?
entry.answer: In that case, Arcee will have Pierce equal to her attack plus the Pierce from the Upgrade. In that example, Arcee’s attack is 1, so she’ll have Pierce 4. However, remember that characters with Pierce can’t deal more damage than their attack total, so she’ll do only 1 damage (not including other attack bonuses or orange battle icons).

entry.question: If there are two cards left in my deck, and I attack with Autobot Cosmos, will his ability trigger?
entry.answer: Yes. You reshuffle your scrap pile into your deck as soon as the deck is empty. In this case, Autobot Cosmos will attack, you’ll flip up the two remaining cards in your deck, and the defender will be KO’d (assuming it has 12 starsor fewer). Your opponent won’t flip any battle cards for the attack if their character is KO’d this way.

entry.question: Say Autobot Cosmos has a Data Pad. Will Autobot Cosmos’s ability trigger if you draw the last card of your deck while he’s attacking?
entry.answer: Yes. Drawing the last card of your deck will cause you to shuffle your deck, and this will cause Autobot Cosmos to KO the defender.

entry.question: Let’s say you attack with another character and flip a white battle icon. Then, because your opponent’s characters are all tapped, you get to attack again. For your second attack, you attack with Autobot Hound and flip a white battle icon. Will his ability trigger?
entry.answer: No. The white battle icon you flipped while attacking with Autobot Hound wasn’t your first white battle icon that turn, so he won’t get the bonus.

entry.question: If the attacking character would deal more than 2 damage, what happens to the extra damage?
entry.answer: The extra damage doesn’t happen. The attacking character will deal only 2 damage.

entry.question: Let’s say Autobot Jazz defends and the attacker has an ability that deals damage to him. Does that damage count for Autobot Jazz’s ability?
entry.answer: Yes. Any damage dealt to Autobot Jazz while he’s defending and his ability is active will count. If the attacker has an ability that deals 1 damage to Autobot Jazz, then he can’t take more than 1 more damage from the attack.

entry.question: If I played an action because of his ability, can I play another action that turn?
entry.answer: Yes.

entry.question: What happens if I have no cards in my hand when I use this ability?
entry.answer: You’ll draw a card, look at it, and immediately put it on top of your deck. You can’t do anything else with the card (like play it) before putting it on top of your deck.

entry.question: Let’s say I reveal one white battle icon during Bumblebee’s combat. Then I flip another white battle icon in the two bonus cards. Will his ability trigger?
entry.answer: Yes. For any ability that looks at what battle icons you flipped, flip your two bonus cards before checking if that ability triggers or not.

entry.question: Does flipping Bumblebee to alt mode mean I have to attack with him that turn?
entry.answer: No. It just lets Bumblebee attack untapped enemies if you decide to attack with Bumblebee.

entry.question: Can Bumblebee still attack tapped enemies that turn?
entry.answer: Yes. Because Bumblebee will be able to attack any enemy, tapped or untapped, you choose which enemy he attacks.

entry.question: Does attacking an untapped enemy cause that enemy to become tapped?
entry.answer: No. The enemy will stay untapped. None of the other rules of combat change.

target.name: Chop Shop - Sneaky Insecticon
target.entry:
If I scrap three Upgrades from Chop Shop, can I repair 1 damage from each of three of my
Insecticons, or do I have to repair 3 damage from one Insecticon?
You can choose a different Insecticon for each repair.

entry.question: If Chop Shop has a Weapon attached to him, can you move another Weapon onto him?
entry.answer: Yes, but you’ll have to scrap the Weapon he originally had.

entry.question: If the Upgrade I move onto Chop Shop has an ability that triggers "when the Upgraded character attacks," does that ability trigger?
entry.answer: No. That Upgrade wasn’t on Chop Shop when he attacked, so that ability won’t trigger.

entry.question: If the Upgrade I move onto Chop Shop gives him Bold or an ability to flip extra battle cards when attacking, do I flip extra battle cards?
entry.answer: Yes. Chop Shop’s ability happens before you flip battle cards, so Upgrades that give Chop Shop Bold will work.

entry.question: Can Chop Shop’s ability be used to move an Upgrade that says "Put only on Planes" onto him?
entry.answer: No. Any ability that says what an Upgrade can be put on still apply, so you can’t sneak Upgrades onto Chop Shop that he can’t have.

entry.question: Let’s say I reveal one white battle icon during Chromia’s attack. Then I flip another white battle icon in the two bonus cards. Will her ability trigger?
entry.answer: Yes. For any ability that looks at what battle icons you flipped, flip your two bonus cards before checking if that ability triggers or not.

entry.question: What happens if one of my characters that’s a Car while in alt mode but not in bot mode is KO’d while it’s in bot mode?
entry.answer: Characters are put in the KO area in the same mode they were in on the battlefield. In that case, the KO’d character isn’t a Car and won’t add to Cliffjumper’s bonus.

entry.question: If I play an Action or Upgrade to increase Demolisher’s defense, do I flip that many more battle cards?
entry.answer: Yes. Consider Demolisher’s current defense, including all bonuses from other cards, when determining how many more battle cards you flip.

entry.question: Dinobot Sludge’s health is 12. Let’s say there are 15 damage counters total on my other Dinobots. When I flip Dinobot Sludge to alt mode, can I move all those damage counters onto him?
entry.answer: Yes. This will, of course, cause Dinobot Sludge to be KO’d. He’ll be sad.

entry.question: Do I put the card on top of my deck before flipping battle cards?
entry.answer: Yes. The card you put on top of your deck (if any) will be the first battle card you flip.

entry.question: Can Grimlock give himself Bold 3 with his ability.
entry.answer: Yes. Grimlock Dinobot. Grimlock count.

entry.question: How does Grimlock’s ability work?
entry.answer: Let’s say Grimlock attacks a character with 10 health and 8 damage counters. If he does 4 attack damage to that character, 2 of that damage is enough to KO the defender. For the extra 2 damage, your opponent chooses one of their other characters. That character would get 2 damage counters.

entry.question: Let’s say the extra damage is enough to KO a second character. Does the extra damage keep going to a third character?
entry.answer: No. The extra damage isn’t attack damage. Continuing the previous example, your opponent could choose a character with 12 health and 11 damage counters and do 2 more damage to it. That character would be KO’d.

entry.question: Can I choose one of my characters and return all its Upgrades to my hand?
entry.answer: Yes. You can choose any character, one of yours or an enemy. You could even choose a character with no Upgrades if you didn’t want to return any to their owner’s hand.

entry.question: If the attacking character would deal more than 3 damage, what happens to the extra damage?
entry.answer: The extra damage doesn’t happen. The attacking character will deal only 3 damage.

entry.question: Let’s say Insecticon Skrapnel defends and the attacker has an ability that deals damage to him. Does that damage count for Insecticon Skrapnel’s ability?
entry.answer: Yes. Any damage dealt to Insecticon Skrapnel while he’s defending will count. If the attacker has an ability that deals 1 damage to Insecticon Skrpanel, then he can’t take more than 2 more damage from the attack.

entry.question: Can I use Jetfire’s ability to put an Upgrade on him if he already has an Upgrade of that type?
entry.answer: Yes, but you’ll have to scrap the Upgrade of that type he originally had.

entry.question: Does Megatron’s ability mean he can hold three Weapons?
entry.answer: Yes. He can have a Weapon in his Weapon slot as well as Weapons in his Armor and/or Utility slots.

entry.question: If I play a Weapon on Megatron, do I have to choose which slot it’s going in?
entry.answer: No. As long as Megatron can hold all the Upgrades attached to him, you don’t have to specify which slot anything is in. For example, if Megatron has two Weapons and a Utility, and you play an Armor onto him, you can choose at that time which Weapon it will replace.

entry.question: When Megatron flips to alt mode, can he keep all his Weapons?
entry.answer: Yes. The bot mode ability applies only to how the Weapons are put on Megatron.

entry.question: Can I look at the bottom card of my deck before putting it under Nemesis Prime?
entry.answer: No. Neither you nor your opponent will know what card it is.

entry.question: What happens to the cards under Nemesis Prime when he’s KO’d?
entry.answer: They’re put into the scrap pile, along with any Upgrades he had.

entry.question: If I flip a white battle icon, do I flip the extra cards before using Optimus Prime’s ability?
entry.answer: Yes. The ability works after you’ve flipped all cards, including extra cards from abilities like Bold or from white battle icons.

entry.question: If I play one of the Actions I flip, do I still count its orange battle icons?
entry.answer: Yes. The Action card was still flipped for the attack, so its orange battle icons will still count.

entry.question: If the Action I play gives Optimus Prime Bold, can I flip more battle cards?
entry.answer: No. You’ve already flipped cards for that attack.

entry.question: If I flip Prowl to alt mode and give my Cars Bold 2, but later in the turn I flip one of my Cars so it’s no longer a Car, does it keep Bold 2 until end of turn?
entry.answer: Yes. Once the bonus has applied, the character will keep Bold 2 until the end of the turn.

entry.question: Prowl’s ability says "When one of your Cars is KO’d -> Repair 3 damage from one of your other characters." Does "one of your other characters" mean other than Prowl or other than the Car that was KO’d?
entry.answer: It means other than Prowl. Prowl can’t repair himself.

entry.question: What happens if I flip Ransack to alt mode and there are no damaged characters?
entry.answer: In that case, nothing happens. No damage counters are put on Ransack.

entry.question: What happens if the only damaged characters are enemies? Can I choose one of my characters and do nothing?
entry.answer: Yes. You choose any other character, damaged or not. Then move 2 damage counters from that character onto Ransack fi you can.

entry.question: How does Ransack’s ability work with Actions or Upgrades that raise his attack?
entry.answer: Ransack’s ability sets his base attack value, what you’d see printed on the card if it didn’t change. From there, Actions and Upgrades can raise that value. For example, if Ransack has 5 damage counters, his base attack would be 5. If he then got a Weapon that gave him +2 attack, his attack would be 7. This wouldn’t change the number of damage counters on him.

entry.question: What happens if the 1 damage counter I move onto the defender is enough to KO it?
entry.answer: If either character is KO’d in the middle of an attack, the attack immediately ends. In that case, you won’t flip battle cards (and neither will your opponent).

entry.question: What does "3 different battle icons" mean? If I flip two orange battle icons and one blue battle icon, does that count?
entry.answer: No. It means you must flip at least one of three different battle icons. For example, one orange, one blue, and one white battle icon.

entry.question: What happens if I have 3 or more cards in my hand when I flip Sunstorm to alt mode?
entry.answer: Nothing. You won’t draw any cards, and nothing happens to the cards in your hand.

entry.question: How does Sunstorm’s ability work with Actions or Upgrades that raise his attack?
entry.answer: Sunstorm’s ability sets his base attack value, what you’d see printed on the card if it didn’t change. From there, Actions and Upgrades can raise that value. For example, if you have 3 cards in hand, his base attack would be 3. If he then got a Weapon that gave him +2 attack, his attack would be 5. This wouldn’t change the number of cards in your hand.

entry.question: What happens if my opponent doesn’t have any melee enemies?
entry.answer: In that case, nothing happens.

entry.question: If I play an Action that puts an Upgrade on one of my Cars, does Wheeljack’s ability trigger?
entry.answer: Yes. That ability triggers no matter how the Upgrade was put onto one of your Cars.

entry.question: If I don’t scrap the card I look at, what do I do with it?
entry.answer: Just put it back on top of your deck.

entry.question: Can I put this on characters other than Bumblebee?
entry.answer: Yes. The Upgraded character will get the +1 attack bonus, although the ability to draw cards won’t work.

entry.question: Can I play Backup Plan if it’s the last card in my hand?
entry.answer: Yes. Your hand will then be empty. You won’t scrap any cards, but you will draw 3 cards.

entry.question: What happens if I play Battle Ready, and then later in the turn the number of Upgrades on one of my characters changes?
entry.answer: The bonus for Battle Ready happens when you play it and won’t change later in the turn, even if you play an Upgrade or one of your Upgrades is scrapped.

entry.question: Assuming I want to use Brainstorm to play two more Actions, how do I order them?
entry.answer: First, choose your first Action. Carry out all its instructions and set it aside. Then choose your second Action and carry out its instructions. Note that you don’t have to choose the Actions ahead of time. For example, if your first Action lets you draw a card, and that card is an Action, you could play that Action as your second one.

entry.question: Do I draw a card before doing the other parts of the effect?
entry.answer: Yes. If a card tells you to do multiple things, always do them in order. First, you’ll draw a card. Then you scrap an enemy Upgrade. Finally, your opponent scraps a card from their hand. (This means they’ll know what Upgrade you scrap before deciding what card to scrap from their hand.)

entry.question: If my character has 2 Cargo Trailers, and I play a different Utility, do I scrap both Cargo Trailers?
entry.answer: Yes. The character can hold up to 3 Cargo Trailers or a different Utility, bot not both.

entry.question: Who picks their Weapon to scrap first? Who picks a card in their hand to scrap first?
entry.answer: Any time both players are given the same instruction, the player whose turn it is goes first. If you play Collateral Damage, first you’ll scrap a Weapon from one of your characters, then your opponent will, then you’ll scrap a card from your hand, and finally your opponent will.

entry.question: Can I play Collateral Damage if none of my characters have a Weapon or if I won’t have any other cards in my hand?
entry.answer: Yes. You can always play an Action card, even if you can’t carry out some of its instructions. Just do as much as you can.

entry.question: If one of my opponent’s characters has a Utility, can I choose not to scrap it and draw a card?
entry.answer: No. If there is an enemy Utility, you must scrap it. You draw a card only if you can’t scrap an enemy Utility.

entry.question: If the Upgraded character’s defense is boosted by actions or Upgrades, does that raise its Pierce number?
entry.answer: Yes. For example, if you play an Armor card that gives that gives the Upgraded character +3 defense, Crushing Treads will give that character Pierce 3.

entry.question: Do blue battle icons add to a character’s defense even if it’s attacking?
entry.answer: No. Similarly, orange battle icons don’t raise a character’s attack when that character is defending.

entry.question: If one of my opponent’s characters has an Armor, can I choose not to scrap it and draw a card?
entry.answer: No. If there is an enemy Armor, you must scrap it. You draw a card only if you can’t scrap an enemy Armor.

entry.question: Which Upgrades should I count?
entry.answer: Only your Upgrades on the battlefield count. Don’t include ones in the scrap pile or your hand.

entry.question: Does Force Field work against damage done by a character with Pierce?
entry.answer: Yes. Even if the attacker has Pierce 5 or more, Force Field will make sure the Upgraded character takes only 4 damage.

entry.question: Let’s say the Upgraded character also has Heroism. If another character would take 5 or more attack damage, what happens?
entry.answer: The damage that would be done to the defender is instead done to the character with Heroism and Force Field. That damage is still attack damage, so 4 damage is done to the Upgraded character instead.

entry.question: Can I put this on characters other than Megatron?
entry.answer: Yes. The Upgraded character will get the +1 attack bonus, although it won’t get Pierce 3.

entry.question: When does the ability check to see if Grenade Launcher should be scrapped?
entry.answer: Any ability that starts with "After the Upgraded character attacks" happens after attack damage is done and the battle ends.

entry.question: If Optimus Prime, Battlefield Legend attacks, and the Action I play puts a Grenade Launcher onto him, will that Grenade Launcher be scrapped?
entry.answer: Yes. After the battle, Grenade Launcher will see that the character it’s upgrading has attacked and its ability will make you scrap it. Similarly, if a character that has a Grenade Launcher attacks, but somehow no longer has that Grenade Launcher after the battle (say, because a Swap Parts put it on a different character), Grenade Launcher won’t be scrapped.

entry.question: What happens if I have more than one character with Heroism and attack damage would be done to a different character?
entry.answer: You can choose which of the characters will take the damage.

entry.question: Does the damage still count as attack damage?
entry.answer: Yes. Any other card that cares about attack damage will still apply.

entry.question: What happens to characters who are in alt mode?
entry.answer: Any character in alt mode, as well as characters who are in bot mode but whose alt mode isn’t a Tank, doesn’t flip. Then each Tank, whether it flipped or not, can get an Armor from your scrap pile.

entry.question: If I have more Armors in my scrap pile than I have Tanks, what happens?
entry.answer: You choose which Armor goes on which Tank. The same is true if you have more Tanks than you do scrapped Armors.

entry.question: How many damage counters does a character in the KO area have?
entry.answer: A KO’d character has damage counters on it equal to its health. Note that this is true even if it took more damage while on the battlefield. For example, if a character with 7 health takes 10 damage, it ends up in the KO area with 7 damage counters. If you return it with I Still Function!, it will end up with 6 damage counters.

entry.question: What mode is the returned character in?
entry.answer: It stays in whatever mode it was KO’d in. If you haven’t already flipped one of your characters, you can flip the returned character to its other mode.

entry.question: Can I put this on characters other than Starscream?
entry.answer: Yes. The Upgraded character will get the +1 attack bonus, although it won’t get Bold 2.

target.name: One Shall Stand, One Shall Fall

entry.question: What happens if this KO’s your opponent’s last character and your last character at the same time?
entry.answer: In that case, the game is a draw. Time to start the next game!

entry.question: Let’s say I play Peace through Tyranny and end my turn with no untapped characters, while at least one of my opponent’s characters is untapped. What happens during my extra turn? Can I attack?
entry.answer: Not unless you find a way to untap one of your characters.

entry.question: What happens if I somehow play two of these in the same turn?
entry.answer: In that case, you’ll take two extra turns after the current turn.

entry.question: What happens if this KO’s all characters on the battlefield?
entry.answer: In that case, the game is a draw. Time to start the next game!

entry.question: Can I put Rapid Ascent on a non-Ranged character?
entry.answer: Yes. It will still get the +1 defense bonus, although the ability of Rapid Ascent won’t trigger.

entry.question: What happens to characters that are already in alt mode?
entry.answer: Nothing. They won’t flip.

entry.question: Will this repair damage from my opponent’s characters if they had Upgrades scrapped from them?
entry.answer: Yes.

entry.question: If one of my opponent’s characters has a Weapon, can I choose not to scrap it and draw a card?
entry.answer: No. If there is an enemy Weapon, you must scrap it. You draw a card only if you can’t scrap an enemy Weapon.

entry.question: What happens to characters who are in alt mode?
entry.answer: Any character in alt mode, as well as characters who are in bot mode but whose alt mode isn’t a Car, doesn’t flip.

entry.question: Does the Car I untap have to be one that just flipped?
entry.answer: No. You can flip any of your Cars, even one that was already in alt mode and didn’t flip.

entry.question: Can I put this on characters other than Ironhide?
entry.answer: Yes. Those characters will get the +3 attack bonus, but they will be damaged by Static Laser of Ironhide’s ability when they attack. If the Upgraded character is Ironhide, that ability won’t do anything and Ironhide can attack without being damaged.

entry.question: What happens if all my characters are tapped when I play Swap Missions?
entry.answer: First you’ll untap one of your characters. Then, because that will be your only untapped character, you’ll immediately tap it.

entry.question: What happens if all my characters are untapped when I play Swap Missions?
entry.answer: Playing Swap Missions in this case is probably a bad idea. Because all your characters are already untapped, you can’t untap any of them. Then you’ll tap one of them.

entry.question: What happens if one of the two characters doesn’t have any Upgrades?
entry.answer: In that case, just move all the Upgrades from the one character to the other. There doesn’t actually have to be a full swap.

entry.question: What happens if an Upgrade can’t be put on the other character? For example, say I have an Upgrade that says "Put on Cars only" and the other character isn’t a Car?
entry.answer: If an Upgrade can’t be put on the other character, it stays where it is. If the other character has an Upgrade of the same type, that Upgrade also stays where it is.

entry.question: If an Upgrade has an ability that says "When you put this on a character" or similar, will that ability trigger if I put it on a new character with Swap Parts?
entry.answer: Yes.

entry.question: Can my opponent choose a different one of their characters for each 1 damage? Can I choose a different creature for each 1 repair?
entry.answer: Yes to both.

entry.question: Are the flipped battle cards put into the scrap pile?
entry.answer: Not right away. Set them aside for now, in the same place you put played Actions cards and battle cards flipped during the attack. Those cards will all be scrapped at the end of the turn.

entry.question: What happens if a player has no cards in their hand?
entry.answer: In that case, the player doesn’t scrap any cards and just draws 4 cards.

entry.question: What happens if a character is both a Truck and a Car?
entry.answer: There aren’t any characters that are both a Truck and a Car.

entry.question: Yeah, but like, what if?
entry.answer: That’s not a real question.

entry.question: Come on… I want to know!
entry.answer: You would repair 2 damage from it and then you would draw 2 cards.

entry.question: When are you going to make a character that’s a Truck and a Car?
What happens if I put Turbo Booster on a character that’s already untapped?
entry.answer: Nothing much. It will get the +1 attack bonus, but the untap ability won’t do anything.
